page.title: 12A Pheasantry
page.content: On the 7th May we went to a pheasantry at Keplahill.Mr Davidson has owned the pheasantry for 15 years,but he lives in Longside.Soon he will be moving to Keplahill because there has been a lot of burglaries.This year Mr Davidson is just breeding pheasantry but last year he breed ducks as well. Just now he has about four hundred pheasants,but when the eggs hatch he should have nearly a thousand chicks. He sells the chicks live for shooting. They are one to six weeks when they are sold.Young chicks cost Â£2.50 and pheasant who haven't laid eggs they cost Â£2.00.Mr Davidson keeps the female pheasants for six or seven months.The hens on average lay five eggs a week.
